item.title: How to Create Modals in React with @headlessui/react
item.description: Have you ever found it difficult to create reusable and accessible dialog or modal components from scratch? Headless UI is a popular library that can help. In front-end development, modals or dialogs are essential components that provide information ...
item.dc:creator: Olamiji Badmos
item.hashnode:content:
Have you ever found it difficult to create reusable and accessible dialog or modal components from scratch? Headless UI is a popular library that can help. In front-end development, modals or dialogs are essential components that provide information or prompt users for input.

In this article, well explore how to leverage Headless UI in React to build robust and accessible modals in React.

Why Use @headlessui/react for Dialogs?

Dialogs, or modals, offer several benefits in user interactions, whether for confirmations, alerts, or forms. Heres why @headlessui/react is an excellent choice for creating dialogs:

  1. Accessibility: Accessibility is vital in front-end development. @headlessui/react ensures your dialogs are accessible to all users, incorporating necessary features like focus management and ARIA attributes.

  2. Customizability: With no predefined styles, you have complete control over the design and layout of your dialogs. You can effortlessly add animations, transitions, and custom functionality to enhance the user experience.

  3. Reusability: Headless UI components are designed to be highly reusable, reducing code duplication and making maintenance easier.

  4. Ease of Use: The library integrates smoothly with other React libraries and frameworks, making it easy to use in both small and large projects.

Setting Up the Environment

To create a modal in React using @headlessui/react, we must first set up our development environment. This involves ensuring you have the necessary tools and libraries installed.

  1. Node.js: Required for running JavaScript on the server side. Download and install Node.js from Nodejs if you haven't already.

  2. Package Manager: You'll need a package manager to manage dependencies and installations. We'll use npm (Node Package Manager) in this article, but you can also use yarn if you prefer.

  3. React Setup: We assume you have a basic understanding of React and a project setup. If not, create a new React app using npx create-react-app my-app to get started with a basic project structure.

Installing @headlessui/react

After setting up the environment, use your command terminal to run the following command to install @headlessui/react

npm install @headlessui/reactor if you prefer using Yarnyarn add
				@headlessui/react

Creating a Basic Dialog Component

Now that we have @headlessui/react installed, let's create a basic dialog component. This will cover the fundamental structure.

const BasicDialog = ({ isOpen,
				onClose, title, children }) => { return ( <Transition.Root show={isOpen} as={Fragment}> <Dialog as="div" onClose={onClose}> <div className="fixed inset-0 z-10
				overflow-y-auto"> <div className="flex items-center justify-center min-h-screen px-4
				text-center"> <Transition.Child as={Fragment} enter="ease-out duration-300" enterFrom="opacity-0" enterTo="opacity-100" leave="ease-in duration-200" leaveFrom="opacity-100" leaveTo="opacity-0" >
				<Dialog.Panel className="fixed inset-0 transform bg-gray-500 bg-opacity-75
				flex items-center justify-center"> <div className="bg-white rounded-lg p-8 max-w-md
				w-full"> <Dialog.Title as="h3" className="text-lg font-medium leading-6
				text-gray-900"> {title} </Dialog.Title> <div className="mt-2"> <p
				className="text-sm
				text-gray-500">{children}</p> </div> <div className="mt-4"> <button type="button" className="inline-flex justify-center px-4 py-2 text-sm
				font-medium text-white bg-blue-600 border border-transparent rounded-md hover:bg-blue-700
				focus:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-offset-2
				focus-visible:ring-blue-500" onClick={onClose} > Close </button> </div> </div> </Dialog.Panel> </Transition.Child> </div> </div> </Dialog> </Transition.Root>
				);};

The component's breakdown is as follows:

  1. BasicDialog is a functional component that receives four props:

    • isOpen: a boolean indicating whether the dialog is open or closed

    • onClose: a function to call when the dialog is closed

    • title: the title of the dialog

    • children: the content of the dialog

  2. The component returns a Transition.Root component, which manages the transition effects. Inside Transition.Root, there are two main elements:

    • Dialog: the dialog container, which renders an overlay and a panel

    • Transition.Child: the animated content of the dialog, which includes the title, children, and close button

  3. The Dialog.Panel component renders the dialog's content, including:

    • Dialog.Title: the title of the dialog

    • div: the children content

    • button: the close button

Example Code for a Simple Modal

Let's see how we can integrate this component into our React application.

import { useState } from 'react';import BasicDialog from '../components/Modals/BasicDialog';export default function ModalTest () { const [isOpen, setIsOpen] = useState(false); const openDialog = () => { setIsOpen(true); }; const closeDialog = () => { setIsOpen(false); }; return ( <div className="text-center mt-4> <button
				onClick={openDialog}>Open Dialog</button> <BasicDialog
				isOpen={isOpen} onClose={closeDialog} title="Example Dialog"> This is a
				simple example of a dialog component using `@headlessui/react`. </BasicDialog> </div>
				);};

This example creates a button that opens a reusable dialog component BasicDialog imported from a separate file when clicked, and the dialog can be closed by clicking the close button, with its open/closed state managed using React's useState hook.

In the image above, you can see the text Open Dialog displayed on the screen, which, when clicked, opens the dialog component.

When the Open Dialog text is clicked, it immediately opens the modal window, which renders the details in the Basic Dialog component, as previously created.

Handling Dialog State

As we explore the dialog component, you may wonder how its state is managed. Specifically, how does the dialog toggle between open and closed states? To achieve this, we utilize React's useState hook in the parent component to manage the dialog's state.

We create two state variables:

  • isOpen: a boolean to track whether the dialog is open or closed

  • setIsOpen: a function to update the isOpen state.

We also define two handlers:

  • openDialog: sets isOpen to true

  • closeDialog: sets isOpen to false

Passing State and Handlers to the Dialog Component

Next, we pass the isOpen state,title and closeDialog handler as props to the BasicDialog component, connecting the state and behavior to the dialog.

<BasicDialog isOpen={isOpen}
				onClose={closeDialog} title="Example
				Dialog"> This is a simple example of a dialog component using `@headlessui/react`.
				</BasicDialog>

Conclusion

In this article, we covered how to create a basic modal component using @headlessui/react. We started by discussing the importance of modals in front-end development and the benefits of using Headless UI for building accessible, customizable, and reusable components. We then walked through the setup process and the creation of a simple dialog component. Finally, we integrated the BasicDialog component into a React application with an example to demonstrate its usage.

item.title: AI and Its Effects on Technical Writing
item.description: Artificial intelligence (AI) is everywhere in today's fast-paced world, changing industries left and right, including technical writing. How technical writers approach their work changes as AI technologies advance, presenting opportunities and challe...
item.dc:creator: Olamiji Badmos
item.hashnode:content:
Artificial intelligence (AI) is everywhere in today's fast-paced world, changing industries left and right, including technical writing. How technical writers approach their work changes as AI technologies advance, presenting opportunities and challenges.

Overview of AI Technologies

Before examining how AI affects technical writing, let's first examine the fundamental AI technologies behind these developments.

  • Natural Language Processing (NLP): is like teaching computers to understand and use human language. It helps machines translate languages, determine if text sounds positive or negative, and summarize long texts into shorter versions.

  • Machine Learning (ML) Algorithms: are like teaching computers to learn from examples. Instead of giving them specific instructions for every task, we show them many examples, and they learn how to do things independently. They use this learning to make predictions or decisions without us having to tell them what to do every step of the way.

The foundation of AI in technical writing is made up of these technologies. They facilitate work automation, increase productivity, and enhance user interaction with technical documents.

Available AI Tools for Technical Writing

AI is changing the way technical writers work. These tools can help with grammar and style checking, content generation, translation, and even user-specific documentation.

Here are some popular AI tools that can help with these tasks:

  1. Grammarly: is an AI-powered writing assistant. Grammarly is like having a personal writing assistant to help you communicate clearly and effectively.

    Key Features

    • Checks grammar, spelling, and punctuation in real-time.

    • Suggests improvements to your writing style and tone.

    • Detects plagiarism.

    • Works with many platforms (browsers, Microsoft Office, etc.)

  2. ProWritingAid: is a comprehensive writing assistant that checks grammar and provides detailed reports on writing style, readability, and structure.

    Key Features

    • Checks grammar and style.

    • Provides detailed reports on your writing's clarity, readability, and structure.

    • Detects plagiarism.

    • Offers specific suggestions to make your writing better.

  3. Quillbot: is a clever tool that helps you rewrite and improve your writing. Quilbot helps you express your ideas in different and creative ways.

    Key Features

    • Rewrites sentences and paragraphs to make them clearer and more engaging

    • Suggests better grammar and style

    • Finds alternative words to use (synonyms)

    • Works with many writing platforms.

  4. ChatGPT: is an advanced language model developed by OpenAI that can generate human-like text. It can be used to create drafts, answer questions, and generate ideas.

    Key Features

    • Natural and coherent text generation

    • Context-aware responses

    • Customizable for specific writing styles

    • Versatile use cases from drafting to detailed explanations.

  5. Hemingway Editor: is an AI tool designed to make writing bold and clear. It highlights complex sentences and common errors, helping writers improve readability and conciseness.

    Key Features:

    • Readability analysis

    • Sentence structure improvement

    • Highlights passive voice and adverbs

    • Web and desktop versions are available

AI tools have changed technical writing by making it faster, more consistent, and higher quality. These tools save time and offer helpful tips that make writing clearer, more accurate, and more interesting. It is important to note that the available AI tools are not limited to the ones mentioned above. As technology continues to evolve, new AI tools are being developed, offering even more advanced capabilities and features. This ongoing innovation ensures that technical writers will have increasingly powerful resources at their disposal to meet the demands of modern documentation.

Impact on Technical Writing

Writing many documents while maintaining accuracy and consistency before artificial intelligence (AI) was challenging for technical writers. But now, AI tools save time and help get things out faster.

AI's effects on technical writing are as follows:

  1. Generating Technical Content: AI-powered tools can help create technical materials like product manuals, user guides, and technical reports effortlessly by automating the writing process and ensuring consistency in language and style.

  2. Enhanced User Experience: Besides creating technical content, AI makes using technical documents more accessible and more helpful. AI tools improve search functions so users can quickly find what they need. Also, AI-powered chatbots give instant help, guiding users through complicated info and fixing problems.

  3. Predictive Writing: AI tools can help writers by suggesting the right content or information as they work on their documents. This saves time and makes the technical writing better overall.

  4. Efficiency Boost: AI helps writers work faster by doing repetitive tasks for them. This gives them more time to focus on the essential parts of their job, making them more productive and getting content out quicker.

  5. Automated Proofreading: AI systems can automatically detect grammatical, spelling, and punctuation errors in technical publications. They also offer ideas for improving and simplifying language. By doing this, writers may ensure that their documents are clear and error-free without spending a lot of time editing.

  6. Multilingual Support: AI helps translate technical content into different languages, ensuring it stays consistent and fits each culture. This means more people around the world can understand the technical documents.

  7. Knowledge Extraction: AI systems can extract valuable information from large datasets, such as industry regulations or technical specifications, and transform it into understandable technical writing. This makes it easier for writers to gather the correct information and gather it into documents.

  8. Workflow Automation: AI helps speed up the writing process by formatting documents, keeping track of changes, and assisting writers to work together. This lets writers spend more time on the content, making documents even better.

The impact of AI on technical writing goes beyond the mentioned effect. These impacts highlight how AI is transforming not just the creation of documents but also information gathering and collaborative teamwork.

Challenges of AI in Technical Writing

Addressing these challenges is crucial for maximizing the benefits of AI in technical writing while minimizing potential problems.

Some of these challenges include:

  1. Inadequate Data Quality: Content produced by AI may be inaccurate or contain false information, which could mislead users. It is essential to ensure high-quality data in technical writing.

  2. Lack of Personalization: AI-generated content frequently needs more human comprehension and insights, making it difficult for readers to relate to or explain complex concepts.

  3. Ethical Concerns: Using AI in technical writing raises ethical issues with plagiarism, secrecy, and privacy. Maintaining moral principles and ensuring that AI-generated work is properly attributed and transparent is crucial.

  4. Security Issues: Since AI tools might not handle sensitive data safely, integrating AI into technical writing presents security issues. The integrity and confidentiality of technical documentation are in danger because of this.

By carefully examining and verifying information, addressing ethical issues through the creation of unique content, customizing content to each individual's preferences, bringing warmth and empathy to the text, and putting security measures in place to protect sensitive information and prevent data breaches, technical writers play a critical role in overcoming the challenges presented by AI in technical writing.

Conclusion

AI has profoundly transformed technical writing by changing how documents are made, managed, and used. It automates tasks like writing and searching, making things faster and more personalized for users. But along with the benefits come challenges like bias and job worries. It's crucial to think about ethics and work with AI to ensure technical communication stays effective and fair in the future.

However, over-reliance on AI tools can have its drawbacks. Excessive dependence on AI-generated content may lead to a lack of originality and human touch in writing. Additionally, AI tools may not always understand the nuanced context of specialized technical content, potentially resulting in inaccuracies. Therefore, while AI tools are valuable aids, they should complement, not replace, the expertise and critical thinking skills of human writers.

References

  • AI and technical writing

  • How does AI impact technical writing?

item.title: How to Easily Record Videos Using Slack
item.description: Introduction Are you looking to take your team collaboration to the next level? Slack has added an exciting new feature: video recording. Whether you're new or experienced with Slack, this article will guide you through the ins and outs of video reco...
item.dc:creator: Olamiji Badmos
item.hashnode:content:
Introduction

Are you looking to take your team collaboration to the next level? Slack has added an exciting new feature: video recording. Whether you're new or experienced with Slack, this article will guide you through the ins and outs of video recording within Slack, uncovering its potential to streamline workflows, enhance clarity, and foster stronger connections among team members. Get ready to supercharge your team's productivity.

What is Slack?

Slack is a cloud-based collaboration platform that facilitates communication and teamwork within organizations. It allows users to create channels for different projects, teams, or topics to share messages, and files, and integrate with various third-party apps. Lots of teams who work from different places use Slack because it's easy to use and helps them get things done.

While there are numerous screen recording applications available, both free and paid, such as OBS Studio, Camtasia, and Screencast-O-Matic, the recent addition of video recording within Slack. This makes things easier for teams because they don't have to use separate tools for recording. Instead, they can do everything in Slack to talk and work together. It shows that Slack is serious about helping teams work better together by giving them new, easy-to-use features.

Recording a Video

Slack offers a built-in video recording feature that allows users to capture and share videos directly within the platform. let's walk through the steps to initiate a recording session:

  1. Start by navigating to the channel or direct message where you want to initiate the recording.

  2. Look for the video call icon within the message bar and click on it to start a video call.

  3. Once the call has started, locate the "Record" button within the call interface and click on it to begin recording.

  4. During the recording session, share your screen and collaborate in real-time.

  5. When you click the record button, it starts recording and brings out the recording timer.

  6. When you're ready to end the recording, simply click on the "Stop Recording" button. The video recording details will appear, and you can download the video directly or select a thumbnail.

Sharing and Collaboration

After recording a video within Slack, you can easily share it with team members to facilitate collaboration and communication. Here's how:

After pressing the "done" button, the recording will conclude. Slack instantly returns us to the direct message where the video recording is located.

[Optional: Rename the video before pressing enter.]

Slack will automatically generate a link to the recorded video. You can then share this link within the same channel or with specific team members via direct message. Team members can click the link to view the recorded video directly within Slack.

Additionally, Slack allows users to download the recorded video for offline viewing or sharing outside of the platform.

Conclusion

Slack's new video recording feature greatly improves its already strong lineup of tools. In this article, we've talked about how Slack is a great place for teams to work together, making it easy to chat and share ideas. We've also explained how to start using the video recording feature in Slack, with simple steps to record and share videos.

This feature allows teams to communicate better, save important conversations, and collaborate more effectively. Whether it's brainstorming, updating projects, or training, using video in Slack helps teams work better together. By embracing this new feature, teams can boost their productivity and succeed in today's fast-paced environment.

item.title: My Journey with DXMENTORSHIP
item.description: Introduction Do you want to work as an advocate for developer relations? The DXMentorship Program might be something to think about. As technology evolves, Developer Relations (DevRel) plays a key role in connecting developers with the wider communi...
item.dc:creator: Olamiji Badmos
item.hashnode:content:
Introduction

Do you want to work as an advocate for developer relations? The DXMentorship Program might be something to think about.

As technology evolves, Developer Relations (DevRel) plays a key role in connecting developers with the wider community. With so many resources out there, finding the right guidance is crucial for success in Developer Advocacy. That's where DxMentorship comes in. They offer a program designed to give aspiring professionals the skills they need to succeed in the industry.

DxMentorship was founded by Ekene Eze, who enjoys teaching individuals interested in DevRel. You can learn how to apply for the program on the DxMentorship Website

Program Overview

The DxMentorship program offers a wide range of lessons essential for aspiring Developer Relations professionals, all packed into a three-month timeframe. With classes led by industry experts and practical assignments, participants gain hands-on experience. Additionally, the program fosters collaboration through its open-source project, allowing individuals to contribute articles on developer relations topics to the DxMentorship Blog.

Benefits of Joining the Program

Joining DxMentorship isn't just about learning, it's about becoming part of the lively Developer Relations community. The program gives you access to experienced professionals, real-world practice, and chances to connect with people from all over the world. Plus, it helps you develop your reputation, gain trust, and make valuable connections in the developer world.

My Experience

As a participant in the current DxMentorship Program Cohort 3, I've had an amazing experience. Right from the start, I've been part of a lively learning environment where I've grown a lot, both personally and professionally. The sessions we've had are interactive and interesting, and I've learned a ton about communicating with developers. Being part of this cohort has taught me to appreciate everyone's effort in following instructions and participating.

With the help and encouragement of my mentors, I've been able to overcome challenges and feel more confident in advocating for developers. The discussions with industry experts have been really easy to understand and have given me a clear picture of what it means to work in developer relations.

The Tool I Found Interesting

As a Developer Relations Advocate, strong writing and research skills are essential. Among the many tools available, Glasp stood out to me.

Glasp is a web and PDF highlighter designed for researchers and learners. It streamlines note-taking, allows easy sharing and organization, and facilitates better comprehension.

Trying out Glasp emphasized the importance of embracing innovative tools for productivity.

Conclusion

The DxMentorship Program offers everything you need to excel in the DevRel sector. With its supportive environment and hands-on learning opportunities, it proves to be an invaluable resource for individuals seeking growth in this industry.

If you're eager to enhance your skills and succeed as a developer relations advocate, enroll in the next cohort and seize the opportunity to propel your career forward with DxMentorship.

Be sure to visit the program's website for any additional information.

item.title: Data Privacy for Dummies
item.description: Introduction Sharing private information online has become commonplace in the current digital world. Whenever we make an online purchase or use social media, we voluntarily divulge a lot of information. However, there is a serious drawback to this co...
item.dc:creator: Olamiji Badmos
item.hashnode:content:
Introduction

Sharing private information online has become commonplace in the current digital world. Whenever we make an online purchase or use social media, we voluntarily divulge a lot of information. However, there is a serious drawback to this convenience, maintaining our privacy.

Protecting personal data from unwanted access, use, or disclosure is the goal of data privacy. In this digital age, it's a major worry. The dangers of improperly managing personal data are evident as we navigate the digital landscape. Serious risks can arise from identity theft, cyberthreats, and improper use of personal data.

Prerequisites

This article is intended for readers who have a basic understanding of online environments, which includes people who use social media, do online transactions, or use the internet for recreational purposes. By guaranteeing this baseline requirement, we hope to enable readers with varying degrees of experience to take proactive steps to protect their digital presence.

Why Data Privacy Matters

In the age of digitalization, data privacy is critical. We disclose a great deal of personal information when we use the internet. Safeguarding this data is essential to maintaining confidence and adhering to ethical norms, in addition to being an issue of security. It's a commitment to preserve your security and confidence, not only to protect information.

  1. Use for Purpose: Information should be gathered with a clear and specific goal in mind. Any departure from this goal necessitates getting user authorization, as it is against the law to misuse or repurpose personal data without consent.

  2. Assurance of Accuracy: It is crucial to guarantee the precision, up-to-date, and significance of the gathered data. This idea protects against the spread of false information and aids in preserving the confidentiality of personal data.

  3. User Control: A key component of data privacy is giving people authority over their data. To maintain control over their digital identity, people should be able to view, edit, or remove their information as needed.

  4. Organizational Accountability: It is the duty of organizations to take accountability for the way they handle data. Ensuring the safety of personal information requires accountability, which is demonstrated by regular assessments, improvements, and a dedication to ethical data practices.

  5. Robust Security: The implementation of robust security measures are necessary to prevent sensitive data from getting into the wrong hands. These measures include encryption and access controls, which together provide a crucial barrier against unauthorized access or data breaches.

Although the above-mentioned principles offer a basic structure, it's important to recognize that the fundamentals of data privacy go beyond these details. Adopting a holistic strategy necessitates ongoing education, flexibility, and a dedication to developing procedures that put the security and integrity of private data first in our dynamic digital environment.

Strategies for Data Privacy

Developing strong data privacy practices is essential in the complex web of the digital world, whether one is a business or an individual. These strategies act as guiding lights to help people and organizations handle sensitive data in an ethical and secure manner.

Personal Privacy Data: You are in charge when it comes to protecting the privacy of personal data! You are in charge of deciding who can access your data, where you want to enter it, and the best ways to protect your private information. Your digital journey is shaped by the decisions you make, and you can create the conditions for a safe and secure online experience by being conscious of your data.

Here are key steps to prioritize data privacy for yourself:

  1. Secure Your Digital Space: Make sure you are safe when using the internet by frequently monitoring and modifying the privacy settings on your social media, email, and other accounts. To improve your overall online security and have control over who can access your information, only share personal details with people you can trust.

  2. Know Before You Share: Take a moment to consider how your personal information will be used before disclosing it online. Each website has a privacy policy, which is a set of guidelines controlling your information. Is your data utilized for a specific reason or is it made public? It may seem boring, but it's important that you read and accept these guidelines.

  3. Enable Two-Factor Authentication and Strong Passwords: Set a unique, strong password for every online account. Whenever it is possible, activate two-factor authentication to further strengthen account security.

  4. Click and Share with Caution: Be careful clicking on email links or attachments, especially from unknown sources. Limit personal info on social media. Today's phishing attempts can be convincing; watch for typos, grammar mistakes, sudden urgency, immediate money demands, or anything suspicious. Trust your instincts and stay cautious online.

  5. Digital Awareness and Literacy: Invest in your own level of digital literacy. Stay informed on what is going on with the internet and recognize and avoid any possible threats.

  6. Safe Wi-Fi Procedures: Make sure your home Wi-Fi is secure by using WPA3 encryption and a strong password. Steer clear of public Wi-Fi when conducting important transactions to lower the possibility of unwanted access.

Corporate Privacy Data: Leveraging user data can offer valuable insights into your customers' needs and preferences. However, with this opportunity comes the responsibility to protect their data diligently.

Here are key steps to prioritize data privacy within your company.

  1. Robust Policies and Training: Establish strong policies for data privacy, provide staff with frequent training, and continuous educational programs. Encourage a mindset of accountability and knowledge to properly safeguard user data.

  2. Encryption and Secure Technologies: Utilize encryption and secure technologies to enhance protection against breaches and unauthorized access to data.

  3. Make a thorough plan for handling incidents: Provide a detailed plan of action for promptly locating, containing, and resolving data breaches in order to minimize the damage they cause to the organization's active data protection culture.

  4. Frequent Compliance Checks: Examine and verify how your company manages data privacy on a regular basis. Verify your adherence to the guidelines and standards and address any problems you discover.

  5. Limit who has access to client data: Not every data must be accessible to everyone. To reduce the chance of breaches, protect data and only provide access to those who really need it. Review permissions frequently, and keep access restrictions ready.

While the strategies mentioned are crucial, it's a good idea to keep up with developments in data privacy. This guarantees that you are up to date with the most recent procedures, reducing the possibility of losing important data, whether personal or corporate. Keep yourself informed to properly protect your data.

Conclusion

As we come to an end to our article, let's go over the main topics again. We have studied "What is Data Privacy, Why Data Privacy Matters" and looked at useful "Strategies for Data Privacy." However, it's crucial to keep in mind that the landscape of data privacy is always evolving. Keeping abreast of events guarantees a robust defense against potential issues, protecting critical data for people and enterprises alike.

Data privacy isn't a one-time thing; it's an ongoing promise. By actively taking care of our digital presence, understanding privacy rules, and keeping an eye on the latest trends, we build a strong shield against online risks. In this world where everything is connected, your data isn't just data, it's a valuable thing that needs careful protection.

In summary, our experience with data privacy serves as a call to action. It serves as a reminder to maintain the safety of our online environment at all times. It's important to create a secure online environment in addition to handling issues as they arise. Prioritizing data privacy helps us safeguard information and equip our communities and ourselves to successfully navigate the digital age.

item.title: The Power and Purpose of DevRel
item.description: Introduction In the ever-evolving landscape of the tech industry, fostering meaningful connections between developers and the products or platforms they use is important. This is where the role of Developer Relations, often abbreviated as DevRel, eme...
item.dc:creator: Olamiji Badmos
item.hashnode:content:
Introduction

In the ever-evolving landscape of the tech industry, fostering meaningful connections between developers and the products or platforms they use is important. This is where the role of Developer Relations, often abbreviated as DevRel, emerges as a crucial component in the realm of technology companies.

Beyond a job title, DevRel is a flexible approach that bridges the gap between developers and the resources, services, or APIs they use on a daily basis. It goes above and beyond traditional marketing strategies by fully committing to the principles of technical advocacy, community building, and cooperative empowerment.

Prerequisites

Explore the fundamentals of Developer Relations (DevRel), emphasize its unique place in the software ecosystem, and discover compelling reasons to think about a career in this exciting sector as you embark on a journey into it. Whether you're a novice to the wide world of technology or an experienced developer familiar with the nuances of code, this article of DevRel provides insightful learning opportunities.

What is DevRel?

The dynamic and varied discipline of Developer Relations, or "DevRel," is essential to the software sector. DevRel is fundamentally about helping developers build meaningful relationships with the tools, platforms, and technologies they use. It delves deeply into community development, technical advocacy, and forming cooperative partnerships, going beyond conventional marketing methods.

DevRel is essentially the link between developers and the resources and tools they require to be successful. It's a deliberate approach to creating a dynamic and active developer community, not just a job title. As educators, advocates, and facilitators, DevRel specialists make sure developers get the resources and assistance they need to prosper in a quickly changing technical environment.

Why DevRel?

Within the ever evolving and innovative tech sector, DevRel is a vital component that transcends traditional commercial methods. DevRel is important because of its special capacity to promote mutually beneficial partnerships between developers and technology suppliers.

Why it matters is as follows:

  1. Developing Credibility and Trust:

    DevRel places a high priority on building credibility and trust in developer communities. It establishes a foundation of dependability by encouraging open and sincere communication, which makes developers feel appreciated and supported.

  2. Facilitating Two-Way Communication

    In contrast to traditional marketing, which frequently functions as a one-way street, DevRel benefits greatly from two-way communication. It promotes open communication, giving developers the chance to express their worries, provide comments, and actively work to enhance goods and services.

  3. Developing Developer Communities

    DevRel gives developer communities more power by offering tools, tutorials, and a platform for collaboration. It goes beyond promoting products; its goal is to support the development and prosperity of the communities it works with.

  4. Maintaining Flexibility in a Changing Environment

    In a field where technology is advancing at a breakneck pace, DevRel is a flexible force that adjusts to shifts quickly. It guarantees that developers have access to the newest resources and expertise, enabling them to stay one step ahead in a cutthroat market.

  5. Encouraging Adoption and Innovation

    DevRel is essential in spurring innovation and accelerating the uptake of new technologies through advocacy work. It acts as a catalyst for change, encouraging developers to investigate novel ideas and stretch the bounds of what is practical.

Essential Features of DevRel

The following carefully chosen combination of components is essential for Developer Relations (DevRel) to flourish and add to its overall efficacy:

  5. Participation in Events:

  6. Campaign Initiatives:

    Developing and overseeing advocacy initiatives is a common component of DevRel. These initiatives seek to honor and empower community leaders, donors, and influencers who are essential in raising awareness and encouraging adoption.

  7. Cross-Functional Collaboration:
    Collaboration with various internal teams, including product development, marketing, and support, ensures a cohesive approach. DevRel acts as a bridge, aligning different departments to better serve developer communities.

What distinguish DevRel from other fields

Developer Relations (DevRel) stands out from other professional fields due to its unique blend of technical expertise, community focus, and strategic advocacy.

Here are key differentiators:

  1. Technical Expertise with a Human Perspective:

    In contrast to traditional technical roles, DevRel demands great interpersonal skills in addition to a thorough understanding of goods. DevRel specialists act as a liaison between developers and technology, converting intricate technical ideas into comprehensible and interesting content.

  2. Community-First Approach:

    DevRel prioritizes the development of communities. DevRel places more emphasis on building deep connections within developer communities than does marketing, which is more concerned with reaching a wider audience. It's more important to promote a feeling of community and cooperation than it is to just sell goods.

  3. Strategic Advocacy Over Direct Sales:

    Direct sales are less important in DevRel than strategic advocacy. DevRel specialists put more of an emphasis on proving value, offering instructional materials, and serving as reliable advisors than they do on pitching items. This strategy fosters enduring commitment and trust among developers.

  4. Building Holistic Ecosystems:

    DevRel is about fostering a comprehensive ecosystem, not just certain products. This entails producing instructional materials, planning gatherings, honoring local authorities, and actively incorporating input from users into the development of new products. It's a thorough strategy that goes beyond short-term sales targets.

  5. Cross-Functional Collaboration:

    Cross-functional cooperation is essential to DevRel's success, although other jobs might function in silos. DevRel professionals collaborate collaboratively with product teams, marketing, support, and other departments to achieve a cohesive and developer-centric strategy.

The dynamic function of developer relations combines technical know-how, community building, strategic advocacy, and a thorough comprehension of the developer ecosystem. DevRel stands out in the professional sector thanks to its unique functionality.

Why consider a career in DevRel?

A job in developer relations offers a special combination of community involvement, powerful advocacy, and technical exploration. DevRel's dynamic landscape draws in interested parties by offering a venue to build important connections, influence technology narratives, and contribute to the developer ecosystem. It's a journey for people looking for a position that offers fulfillment at the nexus of community and technology and breaks through conventional boundaries.

  1. A Wide Range of Skills:

Conclusion

In conclusion, Developer Relations, or DevRel, emerges as a vibrant and influential field at the intersection of community and technology. item.title: Diving into React: Building Your First User Interface
item.description: Unlock React's power! This guide helps you craft scalable, high-performing interfaces, exploring React's simplicity and capabilities for beginners.
item.dc:creator: Olamiji Badmos
item.hashnode:content:
Introduction

Introducing React JS, a dynamic environment that turns creating strong and engaging user interfaces into a joyful adventure rather than a difficult undertaking. React is a game-changer in today's dynamic web environment. It redefines user interface development with its component-based architecture and makes the process of creating scalable and user-friendly apps more straightforward and efficient.

Prerequisites

We'll examine React JS in this tutorial, covering everything from its foundations to its useful applications. Whether you're new to programming or switching from another framework, the goal of this guide is to give you the fundamental skills you need to get started with React.

What is React JS?

ReactJS, a free and open-source front-end JavaScript library developed by Facebook, serves as a foundational tool tailored for constructing user interfaces, particularly designed to excel in single-page applications. Its primary purpose is managing the view layer of both web and mobile applications.

Consider building a house: you start with a blueprint, which is an exact guide that specifies the structure's design and how its components are meant to work together. ReactJS serves as that essential blueprint for web developers. It provides a methodical approach to how components align and interact, acting as a guiding foundation for designers of digital interfaces.

React's architecture, which is based on components, is unique. React divides the user interface into reusable, modular components as opposed to considering it as a single, monolithic piece. Each component simplifies the construction of complicated user interfaces and promotes code reusability by encapsulating its behaviour, appearance, and structure.

The capability of React is utilized by developers to create websites and applications with ease. React gives developers an organized method and sets clear guidelines for how various components should interact and synchronize, enabling them to create aesthetically pleasing, adaptable, and scalable user interfaces for a variety of digital platforms.

Why React JS?

For a few notable reasons, React is at the forefront of contemporary front-end development:

  • Manageability and Simplicity: React's component-based architecture and simple syntax make sophisticated user interface creation manageable for developers of all skill levels.

  • Modularity and Reusability: Its modular elements promote code reuse, improving developer collaboration and shortening project completion times.

  • Effective Rendering: React's deft management of the virtual DOM guarantees quicker rendering, which improves performance and produces a more seamless user experience, particularly in apps with a lot of data.

  • Real-World Adoption: React's features are utilized by industry heavyweights like Facebook, Instagram, Airbnb, and Netflix, demonstrating its capacity to power complex, user-centric apps at scale.

React is more than just high-tech components. It has a fantastic library with simple-to-follow instructions and a group of amiable people who are always willing to lend a hand. In coding, it's like having a superhero sidekick. React simplifies things, allows you to repurpose your code like magic, and creates lightning-fast web pages.

React is the web development industry's rock star because it makes coding enjoyable, easy, and supercharged for all users.

React vs. Vue.js and Angular: What Sets React Apart?

Consider Angular, Vue, and React as distinct automobile types. While they all go to the same destination (creating web applications), their methods and approaches vary.

React is renowned for having;

  • Flexibility: React is incredibly flexible and can be used however developers see fit, much like a personalized toolbox. React offers you more flexibility than Angular, which is a one-stop shop, or Vue.js, which strikes a compromise.

  • Easy to Understand and Available Everywhere: Acquiring knowledge React is much easier to use than its equivalents. It's more approachable for novices because it resembles standard JavaScript. React also boasts a sizable fan base! It's simple to obtain answers and advance your abilities because there are a ton of resources and helpful people available.

  • Different Strategies, Same Objective: Angular is known for its comprehensive approach, whereas Vue.js strikes a balance between minimalism and structure. React is extremely reusable and well-organized since it focuses on building blocks or components.

  • Increasing the Speed of Apps: React's quickness is its secret weapon! It makes programs perform more smoothly, especially when they're large and complex, by utilizing a clever concept called the virtual DOM.

React's notable attributes are its adaptability, simplicity for novices, and the overwhelming community support it receives. Although Angular and Vue.js are useful frameworks, React stands out in the world of web development due to its versatility and ease of use.

The Magic of React's Virtual DOM

Within the realm of web development, React presents a revolutionary idea known as the Virtual DOM, an ingenious helper that transforms the way web pages are updated.

The following is the significance of Virtual DOM:

  • The Real Room and Its Blueprint

    Envision your room, the real area with the furnishings, wall art, and everything you can see and do. That represents your actual web page, much like the Real DOM (Document Object Model) in web development. Imagine, however, that you have a blueprinta written version that outlines the layout of your room. That's what React's Virtual DOM is: it's a lightning-fast drawing, a blueprint of your website's architecture, comparable to the blueprint for your home.

  • Tweaking the Sketch, Not the Room
    When you want to change something in your room, you don't start moving heavy furniture; you adjust your blueprint instead. React does something similarit updates this Virtual DOM sketch, not the actual web page.

  • The Virtual DOM's Superpower
    React's Virtual DOM is like a superheroit quickly figures out what changes you've made in this sketch. This magic assistant compares the updated sketch with the previous one, understanding precisely what parts of the real web page need updating.

  • Making Updates Smarter

    This is where it gets interesting: React modifies only the relevant portions of the original webpage, much like you would when you change a few things in your room without changing the entire layout. React apps run smoothly and quickly thanks to this clever strategy.

By reducing the amount of work required to refresh the web page, this Virtual DOM magic speeds up and improves the performance of React apps, making everything feel incredibly snappy and fast. React's Virtual DOM is similar to a fast, clever plan; it makes React update your website without requiring you to redo anything, guaranteeing that React apps feel incredibly responsive and rapid!

Setting Up React Development Environment

  1. Install Node.js

    • Go to the Node.js website: Visit node.js

    • Download Node.js: Choose the appropriate installer for your operating system (Windows, macOS, or Linux) and download it.

    • Launch the installer: Follow the installation instructions. It includes installing both Node.js and npm (Node Package Manager). npm is automatically installed alongside Node.js.

  2. Verify Node.js Installation

    • Open a terminal or command prompt: Type node -v press Enter. This command checks the Node.js installation and displays its version.

       node
				-v

    • Check npm: Type npm -v press Enter to ensure npm is installed and to display its version.

       npm
				-v

  3. Code Editor Installation

    To write React code, use a code editor such as Visual Studio Code, Atom, or Sublime Text, depending on your preference.

  4. Create a New React Application

    • Use create-react-app: Open your terminal or command prompt.

    • Create a new React app: Run the following command to create a new React application:

       npx
				create-react-app my-react-app

      Replace my-react-app with the name you want for your app.

    • Navigate to the app directory: Enter cd my-react-app to move into your newly created React app directory.

       cd
				my-react-app

  5. Start the Development Server

    • Run the app: In the terminal, type:

       npm
				start

    • Access your React app: Open a web browser and visit http://localhost:3000/. You should see your new React application running!

Finale: Your Journey of Reaction

An interesting journey begins with your introduction to React. The simplicity and effectiveness of React's component-based architecture, which makes UI development easy and scalable, demonstrate the framework's capabilities.

Important lessons learned

  • Foundation Set: Creating a "Welcome to My React App" interface serves as a springboard for more complex work and establishes the foundation for future initiatives.

  • Mastery of Performance: Comprehending the Virtual DOM demonstrates how React maximizes performance without sacrificing usefulness.

  • Further Exploration: For deeper interfaces, go beyond this basic understanding and explore more complex ideas like state management, hooks, and routing.

The Never-Ending Odyssey:

You are on a never-ending journey with React. Each line of code you write and each obstacle you conquer advances you on your path. Accept the learning curve, delve into the richness of React's ecosystem, and feed your desire to create amazing user experiences.

Your exploration of React's world is far from over. Explore React's essential componentsits building blocksin greater detail in the next article. Examine their part in developing dynamic user interfaces and utilizing React development to its fullest.

item.title: A Perfect Guide To Buying The Best Laptop For Your Niche
item.description: Introduction Purchasing a laptop is a significant investment and a decision that will have a considerable effect on your schooling, work, and leisure. With so many unique computers available, it's understandable to feel overwhelmed. You might need to...
item.dc:creator: Olamiji Badmos
item.hashnode:content:
Introduction

Purchasing a laptop is a significant investment and a decision that will have a considerable effect on your schooling, work, and leisure. With so many unique computers available, it's understandable to feel overwhelmed. You might need to figure out where to begin due to the variety of laptop specifications, which include anything from powerful CPUs to RAM that is jam-packed with memory to powerful graphics cards. But do not worry; I am here to make things easier.

When looking for the perfect laptop, there are several factors to consider to guarantee you the most incredible equipment for your needs and budget. In this guide, I'll provide excellent recommendations on what to look out for when buying a laptop, making the process easier and allowing you to make an informed decision.

Prerequisites

Whether you're a student, a professional, a gamer, or a regular user, this article will put you in the right direction.

First, lets talk briefly about laptop Manufacturers. In today's laptop industry, there are numerous manufacturers, each with its unique qualities, and it's only a good idea to look into this uniqueness before purchasing a laptop. Consider construction quality, customer service, reputation, and warranty services. The correct manufacturer can have a significant impact on your experience, so select one that matches your tastes for design, performance, and service.

Selecting a manufacturer or model is the first step in locating the ideal laptop. Other important aspects include processor or processing speed, RAM, storage, display, graphics, battery life, portability, and price limits. These elements combine to form a well-rounded computer experience.

Essential factors to consider when buying a laptop

1. Central Processing Unit (CPU): When shopping for a laptop, one of the most important considerations you'll make is the processor, or Central Processing Unit (CPU). The CPU is the "brain" of the laptop, and it is crucial in deciding the overall performance and capabilities of your computer.

Different Types of Processors:

  • Intel Core Processors: Intel's Core series processors are well known for their high single-core speed and low power consumption, making them a popular choice for various laptops.

  • AMD Ryzen Processors: AMD's Ryzen processors are well known for their competitive performance and low cost. Their multi-core capabilities make them an excellent solution for various tasks.

  • Apple M1: Apple's M1 Processors, found exclusively in MacBook laptops, provide outstanding performance and energy efficiency, especially for macOS users.

  • Intel Xeon and AMD Ryzen Pro: These workstation-class processors are commonly found in high-end laptops designed for professionals and content creators. They deliver outstanding performance and stability for demanding workloads.

These processor suggestions are intended to serve as broad guides to help you choose the best laptop for your unique needs. It's worth noting that you're not confined to the user categories mentioned. The goal is to select a laptop with a processor that matches your needs and computer tasks. Whether you're a student, programmer, professional, or gamer, consider the type of work youll be performing and the applications you'll be using before selecting a processor. The correct processor can improve your whole laptop experience dramatically.

2. RAM (Random Access Memory): The RAM in your laptop is an important feature that controls its processing speed. Low-range laptops typically have 4GB of RAM, and mid-range laptops usually have between 8GB and 16GB of RAM, while high-end laptops have above 16GB of RAM. When selecting a laptop, it is critical to consider your specific requirements.

Get a laptop with at least 8GB of RAM if you intend to use it for intensive work to ensure smooth performance with resource-intensive apps, resulting in a consistent computing experience.

3. Storage (HDD, SSD): Laptop storage is crucial as it directly impacts the speed, multitasking, reliability, and overall performance of your computer.

  • HDD (Hard Disk Drive): HDDs store data on spinning discs. They are often less expensive and have bigger storage capabilities. However, they are slower than SSDs in terms of data access, boot times, and application loading.

  • SSD (Solid State Drive): SSDs store data in flash memory, allowing faster data access, faster boot times, and program loading. Because there are no moving parts, they are more dependable and long-lasting. Also, It is preferable to choose an SSD over an HDD for maximum performance.

SSDs are becoming more popular for laptops since they are faster and more dependable. Previously, there was a combination of SSDs for speed and HDDs for storage, but larger SSDs are becoming more affordable. So, the choice between SSD and HDD is determined by what you require and how much you are willing to spend.

4. Display (resolution, size, panel type): Your visual experience depends on the display. Consider resolution (Full HD or greater), size (13-15 inches for portability, 17 inches for a larger workplace), and screen type (IPS for improved colour and viewing angles, OLED for brilliant colours). Also, the display resolution, size, and panel type should align with your specific needs and how you intend to use your laptop.

5. Graphics: Laptop graphics are crucial for providing a visually rich and seamless computing experience, influencing tasks ranging from gaming to professional work by assuring high-quality visuals and effective program execution.

6. Battery: A powerful laptop battery is like a superhero; it allows you to use your laptop for hours without worrying about locating a power outlet, making it great for business, travel, and leisure. For most users, a laptop with a battery life of at least 8-10 hours is considered advisable, as it provides the flexibility to stay productive and enjoy leisure activities without the constant need for recharging.

7. Portability: Portability is an important consideration when selecting a laptop, and it is affected by characteristics such as weight and size. Thin and lightweight laptops are perfect for mobile productivity, although larger, more powerful laptops may be more suited for stationary use, providing versatility to meet your unique demands.

8. Operating System (Windows, macOS, Linux): When purchasing a laptop, the operating system (OS) you choose impacts program compatibility, user experience, security, ecosystem integration, support, and hardware compatibility, all of which have a substantial effect on your entire computing experience and productivity. Consider an operating system that matches your preferences and software requirements; for example, Windows is adaptable and widely used, macOS is popular among creative workers, and Linux allows for customizations, making it the preferred option by some developers.

9. Budget Constraints: Finding the ideal laptop requires balancing what you need with what you can afford. No amount is too small. So, when shopping for a laptop, keep calm and select a budget that works for you. Laptops are available at a variety of price points, ensuring that there is a laptop to suit every budget. This way, you'll be able to acquire a laptop that meets your requirements without breaking the bank.

10. Future-Proofing: When purchasing a laptop, future-proofing is critical to ensure that your investment remains usable and valuable over time. This implies that your laptop can adapt to changing requirements, perform software and operating system updates, and connect to new devices. Future-proofed laptops have longer lifespans, more fantastic resale prices, and can be more cost-effective in the long run. To accomplish this, look for laptops with upgradeable components, high-performance requirements, a long lifespan, and a trustworthy manufacturer. It's a smart strategy to ensure that your laptop lasts for a long time.

Conclusion

The significance of selecting the proper laptop for certain user requirements cannot be stressed enough. It has an immediate impact on performance, cost-effectiveness, user experience, lifespan, and even security. However, remember that while the advice provided here is appropriate for most users, your specific requirements may differ. Taking the time to examine your needs and choosing a laptop that meets them is essential for a satisfying and productive computing experience.

References

https://www.samsung.com/uk/laptop-buying-guide/how-to-choose-a-laptop/

item.dc:creator: Olamiji Badmos
item.hashnode:content:
Introduction

Keyboard shortcuts are like magic buttons on your computer that make things quicker and easier. They help you get stuff done faster and smoother, which is super important for everyone who uses a computer, no matter what job you have.

Discovering Hidden Keyboard Tricks: Go Beyond the Basics

In the world of the Windows operating system, there exists a vast universe of commands and combinations that go far beyond the common Ctrl+C for copy and Ctrl+V for paste. While these well-known shortcuts are "bread and butter" for many users, there is an entire realm of less popular shortcuts waiting to be discovered.

This article sets the expectation for the hidden treasures of keyboard shortcuts that we will delve into; unveiling a selection of powerful, time-saving, and efficiency-boosting key combinations that may not have crossed your path before. So, fasten your seat belts, reach for the keyboard, and get ready to go beyond the basics as we explore a world of little-known shortcuts in Windows.

Prerequisites

Before diving in, its important to have a solid foundation in place:

  1. Basic Computer Literacy: Ensure you're comfortable using a computer and understand keyboard basics.

  2. Operating System Familiarity: Be familiar with the Windows operating system.

  3. Functional Keyboard: Ensure your keyboard is working correctly, and you know its layout.

  4. Curiosity and Patience: Embrace learning and practice, as mastering shortcuts takes time.

  5. Workflow Optimization Desire: Have a genuine interest in improving your digital workflow.

If you meet these requirements, you'll be fully equipped to utilize the keyboard shortcuts that we will discuss in this article. Regardless of whether you're new to this or a seasoned user, ensuring your readiness is key to elevating your computing experience

Advantages of using keyboard shortcuts

Keyboard shortcuts offer several advantages that make them efficient for increasing productivity by minimizing the time required to execute commands. Think of them as quick secret codes that make your tasks easier and faster.

Let's explore the key benefits of utilising keyboard shortcuts.

  1. Speed:

    It allows users to quickly perform commands or actions by using a few key presses. Instead of clicking all over the place with your mouse, you can press a few keys, and voil! You save time and get things done quicker.

  2. Multitasking:

    In today's busy digital world, many of us need to do several things at the same time. Keyboard shortcuts are helpful tricks that help us switch between different programs or windows on our computer quickly. This is super useful, especially for professionals who have to juggle lots of tasks at the same time.

  3. Reduced Cognitive Load:

    Learning keyboard shortcuts may seem difficult at first, but once you know them, they become like second nature. This makes it easier because you don't have to keep looking for things on menus, and you can concentrate better on what you're doing.

  4. Efficiency and Consistency:

    Keyboard shortcuts saves you time and makes you more adaptable.

  5. Accessibility:

    Keyboard shortcuts can help people who have trouble using a mouse or touchpad to better navigate their computer. These shortcuts make sure that everyone, no matter their abilities, can use computer tools easily.

  6. Reduced Mouse Dependency:

    Relying too much on a mouse or touchpad can make your hand and arm hurt or cause injuries from doing the same motions over and over again. But if you use keyboard shortcuts, you won't have to move the mouse around so much, which can help you work more comfortably and avoid these problems.

Variety of keyboard shortcuts specific to Windows

Windows offer a variety of keyboard shortcuts that help users navigate the operating system, manage windows, and complete activities more quickly. Here are some categories of Windows keyboard shortcuts:

  • Text Editing and Navigation: These shortcuts help you edit and move around text, making your writing and document tasks easier and faster.

    For anybody else who uses text on a Windows computer, keyboard shortcuts for altering and moving text around are incredibly useful. They can speed up and streamline your editing and organizing processes.

  • Windows Navigation: These shortcuts make it simple to navigate your computer, manage open windows, and do tasks more quickly.

    These shortcuts are designed to make multitasking and general navigation more efficient on a Windows computer, improving your overall productivity and workflow.

  • Power Management: These keyboard shortcuts grant you access to a range of power-related functions on your computer, allowing you to perform actions such as restarting, shutting down, and entering sleep mode.

    These shortcuts are created to assist you in controlling and conserving the power of your computer, making it easier to carry out operations and energy-related chores.

Conclusion

As we conclude our exploration of keyboard shortcuts, let's take a moment to reflect. The skill of learning keyboard shortcuts involves more than just learning key combinations; it also involves taking control of your digital environment.

Therefore, keep in mind that learning a new keyboard shortcut will help you become a more effective and productive version of yourself as you pursue your digital interests. Accept them, work them into your routine, and watch as your abilities rise, making your encounter with technology more satisfying and rewarding.

Keyboard shortcuts in Windows

What is the advantage of using Keyboard shortcuts?

item.description: At this rate I think I need to sit my folks down and give them a long lecture on why my physical presence in the house doesnâ€™t equate availability! ðŸ˜‚ So Iâ€™ve been working on this application lately, an e-commerce application that offers customers th...
item.dc:creator: Olamiji Badmos
item.hashnode:content:
At this rate I think I need to sit my folks down and give them a long lecture on why my physical presence in the house doesnt equate availability! ðŸ˜‚

So Ive been working on this application lately, an e-commerce application that offers customers the opportunity to connect with international stores and deliver products to their doorstep without hassle. While trying to provide solutions to people across the globe I realized I have an internal issue I needed to fix in my house to make significant progress on the project.

As a front end developer - a fast growing enthusiastic one - I wasnt so lucky at my first job, maybe because it wasnt an all "techy" environment although tech was really needed to drive operations. I didnt get to enjoy the luxury of working from home at least thats what I used to think.

I opted to freelance just so I could enjoy the luxury of working from home. I got a few gigs from colleagues and friends in the space and I set up a low budget workspace - work desk was my ironing table and chair was an old chair from my mums office, now you can relate to why I said its low budget - right there in my sitting room.

Before now, I used to envy people that work from home but it appears that our reality differs depending on some factors such as location, available resources, etc.

My first hurdle was time management. Id wake up early as usual to do my normal routine but because I dont step out of my house it feels like time runs faster and differently from when I worked from a physical location. I would always tell myself that my PC is right there on my table so I dont need to rush as I can reach it anytime I want to.

I struggled to keep up with deadlines until I realized that the only difference between working from home and working from a physical location is the settings, I soon learned that I have to treat my low budget table and chair as an office. So I got myself a white board and a marker and would write my plans for the day, work closely with it like I would in an office, and I started adjusting.

Time management soon became a thing of the past then my folks came around for holiday, my mum was on leave and every time she sees me on my laptop shell ask what exactly do I press the whole day. ðŸ˜‚

Somedays I would be asked to prepare breakfast for my nephews and nieces, sometimes lunch but I cant refuse - its a typical Nigerian home so itll take a while for my explanation to sink. Now its an issue of my task fighting with my folks for my availability.

I struggled to find a balance, my folks couldnt stomach the reality of me being in the sitting room but not interested in whatever theyre doing at a particular time, they couldnt agree with me saying Im not available at the moment when they can see me physically.

It really was a huge problem for me but I had to get the job done. So I changed my schedule, I became nocturnal at least for time being.

I would work all night and sleep by the day, but guess what? That only lasted for a while until my mum starts asking why do you sleep all day like one who doesnt have a job? She eventually understood my routine although not totally and shell make jest of me sometimes saying its not under my nose youll be in this house and Ill be cooking for you morning, afternoon, and night.ðŸ˜‚

So far it has been a great journey, a challenging one and Im happy that Im able to find a solution to each of the problems that come my way, maybe slowly but I always pull through and its always with the help of my family.

Many of you wouldve thought that after getting an interview opportunity, all you need to do is perform well in the interview, right? Yes, somehow true as well, but performing well in the interview and securing the job opportunity is not sufficient alone in the tech world, especially if we talk about it from the long-term career perspective.

There are various red flags that we candidates usually ignore noticing during the interviews and then we realized it later after being employedðŸ˜ŸðŸ˜žIt's always advisable to know if the particular company is worth working for or not.

Right here, I would discuss some of the most watch out red flags we tend to ignore during any tech interview(based on my experience)

  1. The interviewer does not have enough clarity about the offered role: If the interviewer isn't being able to give a breakdown of what the job role entails, how that particular role affects the companys core business. Such a situation like this can lead to any of the future possibilities after joining the company youd be required to do some irrelevant work.

  2. There is not any technical interview round: This look small as it seems but sincerely this is a major phase in every tech interview. If there is no discussion about technical skills then you should JAPA i.e runðŸƒðŸƒ The absence of any technical skills assessment during the interview would only signify that it is not necessary for that particular role which is something contradicting, considering the role for which youre applying but at least a technical round is a must.

  3. The company has no or few old employees: You must be thinking that how a company with no older employees can be a red flag for you? if the company exists for a long time but has zero or few old employees then it can lead to various possibilities like employees leaving frequently due to substandard working conditions, terrible management, not-so-entertaining payscale, or any other reason.

  4. The interviewer is not open for any solution: During the interview, if youre given a programming problem. And you come up with an optimal solution for it within the given timespan but the approach is slightly different from the one the interviewer is comfortable with. Then, if the interviewer accepts your solution as well as lets you know his approach as well then everything is fine but if the interviewer strictly discards your solution (even though it is correct) without giving any justified reason then it is a warning sign for you to rethink whether the company is the right fit for you or not. This is very crucial because it shows that after joining the company you may not get the required flexibility while working on a project.

These are just some prominent red flags that you must look out for during a tech interview to make better decisions for your career.

I will also recommend that instead of declining any job opportunity immediately after finding a red flag during the interview, you need to ask yourself some questions like how will it impact your career, also can it be resolved, etc. before making the final decision of accepting the job offer!

item.hashnode:content:
I know you've been wondering what technical writing is?

Technical writing is the art of providing detail-oriented instruction to help users understand a specific skill or product.

If you've always wanted a career in tech, love writing, teaching others, already in tech that don't really fancy coding all day or looking for something else you can do. Technical writing could be a suitable career for you.

A technical writer is someone who writes instructions or technical documentation such as user manuals, support articles, or internal docs for developers. A technical writer presents the technical information in a way that readers can use that information for an intended purpose.

You do not need a degree in technical writing to start putting out technical content. All you need to do is Just Start Writing

We will be looking at the fundamentals and also what you should consider when getting started with technical writing.

Necessary Skills to Have as a Technical Writer

  1. The use of proper English and Possess some writing skills:It is always necessary to have a good grasp of English and basic grammar before considering writing. Also, one can only learn how to write by actually writing. You might never know you have it in you to write until you put pen to paper. And the only way out is to keep writing.

  2. Know how to explain things clearly and simply:This is a very crucial skill. Knowing how to implement a feature doesn't necessarily mean you can clearly communicate the process to others.

  3. Experience in the technical field:This isn't a must but it is a huge advantage over others to have some experience or strive to get knowledge in the technical field such as product management, quality assurance, user experience, engineering and business development.

Technical Writing Process

The biggest factor to consider when you're writing a technical article is to analyze and understand who your readers are that is your intended/expected audience. A good technical writer writes based on the readers context.To understand your reader, you need to ask yourself some certain questions before writing:

  • Who are my readers?
  • What do they need?
  • Where will they be reading?
  • When will they be reading?
  • How will they be reading?
  • Why will they be reading?

These questions also help you think about your reader's experience while reading your writing.Also, as a technical writer you need to make a decision on how to present the documentation content such as:

  • What your users need to know
  • How will they use the documentation
  • How much time do you have to work on the project
  • How many different deliverables are produced from the same content
  • Whether the documentation is task based or reference based in a technical field.

Don't get confuse, I will briefly explain what I meant by a documentation is task based or reference based. Let's dive into it.

A task-based approach is what the users does, the instructions on how to operate the product, to accomplish the task the user performs while a reference based approach is what the product or article you are writing about does, what it looks like and also what each menu, item, button(features) do.

In a real world, a reference based approach takes less time to develop than a task based approach because there is less thinking and planning.

It is always advisable for a technical writer to identify the key goals for users of the product and then for each goal, create a scenario of how users will accomplish the goal.

Necessary Knowledge to Succeed:

As I stated earlier, it is a huge benefit to have some experience in the technical field to succeed as a technical writer. There are three(3) types of knowledge listed below:

  1. The Product Knowledge:This is an understanding of a product or service. A technical writer understands the product application ,function, feature, use and support requirements.
  2. The Technical Knowledge:This is the logical understanding of how systems and processes work and interact with each other.
  3. The User Knowledge:You should basically know what your audience wants, look for analytics where you can get information about potential uses.

Importantly, there are many reasons why it's a good idea for a technical writer to gain extensive product and technical knowledge because:

  • You as a technical writer will gain respect from the developers and be able to talk with them with intelligence.
  • You will be able to determine whether the information you received or read for the report is correct.
  • You will be able to write much faster than you would if you know nothing.
  • You will also have confidence that your documentation is accurate even when it has not been sufficiently reviewed by the subject matter experts.

Fun Fact: The more knowledge you have, the better documentation you can create.

Understanding Audience and Purpose

Remember, the goal is to write a document that is both useful to and useable by your readers. Bearing in mind who your users are, you can then conceptualize and plan out your documentation. This process consists of planning, drafting, revising, editing and proofreading.It is also advisable for a technical writer to avoid excessive jargons, limit the vocabulary, define abbreviation, keep sentences short and use active voice in the documentation for effective communication.

Conclusion

One of the interesting part about gaining a product knowledge is that technical writers often are not the real users of the product they document. You need to learn a wide body of research skills, set up a small focus group or send out a very direct survey. A technical writer need to focus on what the user wants to know about the product.

It is advisable for a technical writer by being the user. This is probably the most important thing about any job, regardless of your like or dislike of the product.

Technical writers have to be always eager to learn something new and not be afraid of it, which means technical writers are not only writers but also learners.

Note that all you need is to start writing such as writing on your personal blog and contribute to open source on GitHub. You can also write about a product you love to use, but its documentation is poorly written or not in existence.

I'm glad you now understand what technical writing entails.#

Start writing... Can't wait to see your technical articles
